mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Union Station was designed by architect Jarvis Hunt and opened in 1914 as the main train station for Kansas City, Mo. Designed as part of the City Beautiful Movement in Beaux-Arts style, Union Station was at the time the second-largest union station in the country. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Station_(Kansas_City,_Missouri) [work]
